paper_title.ja: 歩行時のPoint-Light Motionに対する人らしさの要因分析

ja.name: 藤井 亜希彦,鈴木 真,柴田 滝也

publication_name.ja: 日本感性工学会論文誌

paper_title.en: Using optical flow in motion analysis for evaluation of active music therapy

description.en: In this study, we focused on the disabled children to introduce their voluntary motion. Motion analysis of their active music therapy is important for evaluation and planning, but the quantitative method is not well established yet. Since the therapists are too busy to spend time for analysis, more automatic tool is needed than the conventional motion analysis software. Therefore we investigated the use of optical flow in analyzing the client's motion from the recorded video of music therapy. For this purpose, Lucas-Kanade method was used to calculate flow vectors. This algorithm needs feature points to be detected before flow calculation. Such features are limited to the ROI, that is, a part of the child's body. Therefore mask image is introduced to specify the area for feature detection. OpenCV was used to develop experimental software and 12 video images of 5 subjects were processed. From the experimental results, the use of mask image to configure ROI was found to be effective. Though the correlation between results of optical flow and that of the conventional motion analysis was low in some cases, the timing of the detected motions was agreeable enough. These results may be effective for quantitative evaluation and intuitive visualization of active music therapy. © Springer International Publishing Switzerland 2014.

paper_title.ja: 音楽療法における自発動作評価への上肢運動解析の応用
paper_title.en: Application of Motion Analysis of Upper Limbs to Evaluation of Self-motion in Music Therapy

description.ja:
本論文では、音楽を用いて自発動作を促すような能動的な音楽療法に関して、その実施効果を定量的に分析することを目指し、対象者が楽器に触れようとする上肢運動についての解析手法を検討した．カメラ１台での色マーカによる二次元的計測を採用し、Rett症候群などを対象に行われたセッションについて、継続時間、手首運動の頻度や振幅から、実施者の主観的評価を数値的に裏付ける情報を得ること
ができた．
description.en: Recently music therapy is used to improve physical and mental condition of people. Since its evaluation is subjective at this moment, establishnment of objective methnod is needed. In this paper, we describe application of motion analysis of upper limbs to music therapy for handicapped children, and discuss on the desirable evaluation for self-motion during music therapy. To reduce influence on subject, two dimensional analysis using single camera was applied, and color tape-shaped marker was attached to the wrist and shoulder of the subject. We peformed analysis in 7 cases of 3 subjects and calculated the amplitude and frequency of motion of the arm. Results well reflectd subjective comment of the therapists, and showed that motion analysis is effective for evaluation of self-motion in music therapy.
